title: Warnings and Wisdom
shortSummary: Proverbs 6 offers practical warnings against financial entanglements, laziness, wickedness, and adultery, while emphasizing the importance of wisdom, discipline, and obedience to parental instruction. This chapter highlights the consequences of folly and the blessings of living according to God's commands.

keyCharacters.name: The Sluggard
keyCharacters.description: A lazy person warned against in verses 6-11, exemplifying the dangers of idleness and lack of foresight.

keyCharacters.name: The Wicked Man
keyCharacters.description: A deceitful and malicious individual described in verses 12-15, whose actions bring sudden calamity.

keyCharacters.name: The Adulterous Woman
keyCharacters.description: A figure representing temptation and moral danger in verses 24-35, illustrating the destructive consequences of unfaithfulness.

keyCharacters.name: The Son
keyCharacters.description: The recipient of the father's wisdom and warnings throughout the chapter, symbolizing the learner or disciple.

definitions.definition: A person who guarantees the debt or obligation of another, risking personal loss if the debtor fails to pay.
A lazy or idle person who avoids work and diligence, leading to poverty and want.
Stubbornly contrary or perverse in behavior or attitude, often leading to mischief and discord.
Something detestable or loathsome to God, often referring to sinful behaviors that provoke His wrath.
Corrective guidance or discipline intended to teach and lead one toward righteous living.

outline.heading: Warning Against Financial Suretyship
outline.description: The father warns the son against becoming surety for others, urging him to quickly free himself from such obligations to avoid ruin.

outline.heading: Exhortation to Diligence
outline.description: Using the example of the ant, the son is encouraged to avoid laziness and to work diligently to provide for himself.

outline.heading: Description of the Wicked Man
outline.description: A portrayal of a deceitful and malicious person whose actions lead to sudden and irreversible disaster.

outline.heading: Seven Things the LORD Hates
outline.description: A list of behaviors and attitudes detestable to God, emphasizing the moral standards expected of His people.

outline.heading: The Value of Parental Instruction
outline.description: The son is urged to hold fast to his parents’ teachings as a guiding light and protection against evil.

outline.heading: Warning Against Adultery
outline.description: A strong admonition to avoid the temptations of the adulterous woman, highlighting the severe consequences of unfaithfulness.

application: Avoid financial entanglements that could lead to personal ruin by exercising caution before guaranteeing another’s debt.
Cultivate diligence and discipline in daily life, following the example of the ant to avoid the pitfalls of laziness.
Guard your heart and mind against deceitful and wicked behaviors that provoke God’s judgment.
Hold firmly to the instruction and commandments of your parents and God’s Word as a lamp to guide your steps.

keyVerses.text: Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:
keyVerses.significance: This verse calls believers to learn from the ant’s industriousness, encouraging a life of diligence and wisdom.

keyVerses.text: These six things doth the LORD hate: yea, seven are an abomination unto him: A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood, An heart that deviseth wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief, A false witness that speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren.
keyVerses.significance: This passage clearly defines behaviors that are detestable to God, guiding believers to avoid sin and pursue holiness.

keyVerses.text: For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:
keyVerses.significance: It emphasizes the life-giving and guiding power of God’s commandments and correction in the believer’s life.

keyVerses.text: But whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding: he that doeth it destroyeth his own soul.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the destructive spiritual consequences of adultery, warning believers to flee temptation.
